alert.note: Alert for Laurens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:45AM EST until January 09 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Laurens County in upstate South Carolina... * Until 500 PM EST. * At 1145 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Heavy convective rainfall will overspread greater Laurens and Clinton through midday. A period of severe urban-type flooding is probable. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Laurens, Clinton, Fountain Inn, Joanna, Gray Court, Cross Hill, Waterloo, Lake Greenwood, Mountville, Ora, Enoree, Hickory Tavern, Kinards and Princeton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
